intro: Coccothrinax fagildei, commonly known as the Fagilde's palm, is a rare and endemic species native to the island of Hispaniola. It belongs to the Arecaceae family and is characterized by its slender trunk and pinnate leaves. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments within tropical forests. Its small, clustered inflorescences produce both male and female flowers, facilitating wind pollination. Due to habitat loss and limited distribution, it is considered endangered and requires conservation efforts to ensure its survival.
